radioGroup.prompt: Does your language have any marking on the adjective to show agreement with the head noun when the adjective phrase is part of a nominal phrase?
radioGroup.radio: Yes - they agree in animacy (and possibly also in number)
Yes - they agree in class number (and possibly also in number)
Yes - they agree in gender (and possibly also in number)

form.instruction:
In the lexicon, mark the adjectives that can only go with animate nouns with the feature animate. Mark the adjectives that can only go with inanimate nouns with the feature -animate. Do not add any animacy agreement feature to those which can go with either animate or inanimate nouns. Or, if animacy agreement is specified by an affix, mark the affix(es) with the appropriate feature(s). (Nouns will be marked in the next section.)
If your language also has number agreement: in the lexicon, mark the adjectives that can only go with singular nouns with the feature singular. Mark the those that can only go with plural nouns with the feature plural. Do not add any feature for number agreement to ones which can go with either singular or plural nouns. Note: if your language makes a further distinction for dual marking, add the feature dual to the appropriate entries. If the number agreement features are specified by affixes, mark the affixes with the appropriate features instead. (If your language does not have this type of agreement, simply do not add any features.)

In the lexicon, mark the adjectives that can only go with a particular class with the feature class_##, where ## is replaced by a number between 1 and 99. It may be the case that the same affixes that mark the class number on adjectives (and possibly articles and demonstratives too) also mark the class number on nouns. If this is the case in your language, simply add the class feature to the affixes, and all the words will automatically come from the morphological parser with the class number marked. Any cases where adjectives do not have an affix which marks the class will require marking of the class feature on the particular lexical item in the root dictionary. (Nouns will be marked in the next section.)
If your language also has number agreement: in the lexicon, mark the adjectives that can only go with singular nouns with the feature singular. Mark the those that can only go with plural nouns with the feature plural. Do not add any feature for number agreement to ones which can go with either singular or plural nouns. Note: if your language makes a further distinction for dual marking, add the feature dual to the appropriate entries. If the number agreement features are specified by affixes, mark the affixes with the appropriate features instead. (If your language does not have this type of agreement, simply do not add any features.)

In the lexicon, mark the adjectives that can only go with masculine nouns with the feature masculine, adjectives which can only go with feminine nouns with the feature feminine, and adjectives which can only go with neuter nouns with the feature neuter. Do not add any gender agreement feature to those adjectives which can go with nouns of either gender. Or, if gender agreement is specified by an affix, mark the affix(es) with the appropriate feature(s).(Nouns will be marked in the next section.)
If your language also has number agreement: in the lexicon, mark the adjectives that can only go with singular nouns with the feature singular. Mark the those that can only go with plural nouns with the feature plural. Do not add any feature for number agreement to ones which can go with either singular or plural nouns. Note: if your language makes a further distinction for dual marking, add the feature dual to the appropriate entries. If the number agreement features are specified by affixes, mark the affixes with the appropriate features instead. (If your language does not have this type of agreement, simply do not add any features.)
